title: Ribafreixo 2014 Pato Frio Red Edition Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine, with its earthy aroma and light oak aging, is made for early drinking. Its red fruits and acidity are generous, rounded with the warmth of the Alentejo in its texture. The wine can be drunk now.

title: Schmidt 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Applegate Valley)
description: Thick, oaky and exceptionally high in alcohol, there's no subtlety to this wine. The full-bodied fruit flavors bring apple, melon and papaya into play, but it would be difficult to match this to food.

title: Sunset Hills 2016 Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)
description: This Chardonnay is reminiscent of a fruit salad, with lush aromas and flavors of lemon, banana, pineapple, honeydew and peach yogurt. Mild acidity keeps everything in check and leads to a short finish.

title: Sutcliffe 2015 Pinot Noir (Colorado)
description: Spicy aromas of licorice and cedar mingle with vanilla and cassis on the nose. The tannins are somewhat gritty on the palate, with spicy black pepper, cedar and pomegranate flavors. The acidity helps pull this wine together but tannic, oaky flavors overpower with only a suggestion of black fruit on the lingering finish.

title: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Not quite as concentrated as the previous vintage, the fruit flavors of melon and pear are correctly varietal, yet somewhat dilute. The wine was fermented entirely in tank, and there is just a hint of metal flavoring the finish.

title: Tommasi 2016 Le Fornaci  (Lugana)
description: Subdued aromas of nut, dried apricot and overripe nectarine zest all follow over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of yellow apple. A light touch of almond marks the close.

title: Triacca 2012 San Domenico  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: This opens with muddled aromas suggesting minestrone soup, prune, celery and coffee that carry over to the full-bodied palate along with mature black cherry, baking spice and crushed black olive. Loose-knit, close-grained tannins try to hold it all together.

title: Villa Schinosa 2016 Nero di Troia (Puglia)
description: While oak dominant on the nose in aromas of roasted berries, the palate reveals a bit more complexity and balance. Medium-bodied and silken in feel, this shows ripe berry flavors, lifted by shades of violets and crushed granite. There's a slight dip in concentration on the midpalate yet overall this is enjoyable for its soft, approachable feel.

title: Vinum 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Lush and rich aromas of candied red cherries and vanilla dust show on the nose of this bottling. Rosewater and fruit punch flavors arise on the sip, riding into a vanilla dust finish.

title: Wind Rose 2016 The Keeper Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: Light aromas of melon, pear and herb lead to similarly faint fruit flavors. It's cleanly made but everything seems very dialed back.

title: Xiloca 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Furry plum and berry aromas are good but fragmented. Racy acidity creates tension and some rawness on the palate, while this wine tastes of tart black plum and black currant. Latent acidity on the finish results in strained freshness.

title: Casa de Valor NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Lettuce and white-fruit aromas lead to a plump palate with modest acidity. Yeasty melon and powdery apple flavors dry out on the finish, leaving a note of tropical papaya.

title: Castellví de la Marca NV Santa Monica Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Slightly stalky aromas are not the cleanest. In the mouth, this has lime-like acidity and yeasty white-fruit flavors that include mild green notes. A chalky finish closes out this basic Cava.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Hints of fresh, green pear and a touch of lemon appear on the nose. The palate offers more of the same on a dry, light body which lacks a little focus. Drink soon.

title: Château Bel Air Gallier 2015  Graves
description: Rich, probably too rich, this is a smooth, concentrated wine. Its tannins are already embedded in the cushion of superripe fruit offering flavors of black plums and dark chocolate. The wine will age quickly; drink from 2019.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2013 Conde Valdemar Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Raisin and prune aromas announce a chunky palate that's solid but not agile or elegant. Flavors of prune and cassis come with a sense of grape skins. It finishes well.

title: Boomtown 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of red currant are bright and fresh, with little apparent new-oak influence. Raspberry and currant flavors bring more of the same. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.

title: Dachshund 2016 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Subdued notes of lemon and herb on the nose extend to the palate of this off-dry, slightly earthen Riesling. Pressed apple and pear flavors are moderately concentrated but pleasantly clingy on the finish. Drink now.

title: C.G. di Arie 2014 Mixed Breed Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a good, solidly built table wine with a robust texture and bold fruit and dark-spice flavors. It barrels straight ahead in style and will easily wash down some Korean barbecue or steak fajitas.

title: Cà Maiol 2015 Contato  (Lugana)
description: The nose is rather subdued but eventually reveals suggestions of citrus peel, toast and a whiff of medicinal herb. On the lean palate, an unusual sensation of adhesive bandage underscores yellow-apple peel and bitter walnut.

title: Château Clos Junet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. With its firm tannins well in place, this dense wine is going to need aging. As of now, the fruit only shows dimly through the structure. Hopefully, the bitter flavor from firm extraction will not remain so strong.

title: Ets Thunevin 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. A light and fruity wine with attractive acidity, this is an easy wine that is ready to drink now.

title: Château Soudars 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. Heavily structured, this wine is tough at this stage. Spice and toast from the wood are on the edge of excessive, with not enough space for the fruit. The black fruits need a chance to come out.

title: Johan 2014 Blaufränkisch (Willamette Valley)
description: The grape is rare in Oregon, and most commonly found in Central Europe, where it produces a spicy tannic somewhat rustic red. Here, it's rather thin, in both color and flavor, with dilute strawberry fruit. It's texturally most interesting, and that holds your attention through an otherwise ordinary finish.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Original Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: First produced in 1850, this is widely seen as the original branded red wine in Portugal. The Castelão fruit, then and now, comes from the Setúbal Peninsula. It gives a crisp, juicy and light wine with soft tannins. There is some spice, although the main thrust of this wine is delicious red fruit. Drink now.

title: Legado del Moncayo 2016 Garnacha Blanca (Campo de Borja)
description: Aromas of clover and yeasty vanilla lack concentration. This feels a bit oily, while nonspecific citrus flavors finish with a note of grape skins and brine. It's acidic and medium to light in body.

title: Malavasi Daniele 2016  Lugana
description: White peach and citrus blossom aromas take center stage. On the ripe simple palate, a light note of bitter almond underscores mature yellow apple while a note of candied orange drop marks the finish.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Loidana Red (Priorat)
description: Earthy, soupy berry aromas are touched up by forced oak. This wine is tannic, screechy and acidic on the palate, with a swath of creamy oak. Herbal, saucy plum and berry flavors finish raw, pulling and tannic, with an excess of oak flavor.

title: Masseria Altemura 2014 Sasseo Primitivo (Salento)
description: Jammy red-fruit aromas linger under a blanket of oak-driven coffee in this wine. The palate mirrors the aromas, yet the creeping acidity and medium-grained tannins offer a nice counterbalance.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This seems somewhat disjointed and angular, with tart, almost sour berry and cherry fruit. There are acetic scents and chewy tannins. Though labeled reserve, it's a wine that fails to deliver the more subtle pleasures of the grape. Perhaps this would best be served along with a hearty stew.
